modules.description: Provides operations to convert between Unix file descriptors and libuv's os_fd type. Works with Unix.file_descr and Luv_c_types.Os_fd.t. Used to interface with low-level I/O operations in a cross-platform manner, ensuring proper handling of file descriptors in Unix-like environments.

Provides operations to convert between Unix file descriptors and libuv socket handles. Works with Unix.file_descr and Luv_c_types.Os_socket.t types. Used to integrate low-level Unix sockets with libuv-based networking code, such as when bridging with event loops or asynchronous I/O handlers.

Converts between Unix file descriptors and libuv's os_fd and os_socket types, enabling seamless integration of low-level I/O and networking operations. Supports Unix.file_descr, Luv_c_types.Os_fd.t, and Luv_c_types.Os_socket.t, allowing for cross-platform handling of file and socket descriptors. Enables direct manipulation of file descriptors in Unix environments while interfacing with libuv's event-driven architecture. Examples include bridging Unix socket APIs with asynchronous I/O handlers or managing file descriptors in a portable manner across systems.

Provides asynchronous I/O operations, process management, and thread coordination through a low-level interface. Works with file descriptors, sockets, and OS-level resources to enable non-blocking network and system calls. Enables building high-performance network servers and concurrent task execution across threads.

Handles conversion between Unix file descriptors and libuv's os_fd and os_socket types, enabling integration of low-level I/O with asynchronous operations. Supports Unix.file_descr, Luv_c_types.Os_fd.t, and Luv_c_types.Os_socket.t for cross-platform descriptor management. Allows direct manipulation of file and socket descriptors within Unix environments while leveraging libuv's event-driven model. Enables tasks like bridging Unix socket APIs with non-blocking I/O or managing file descriptors in a portable way.
